text: Jordan Jesús Silva Díaz (born August 30, 1994 in Matehuala, San Luis Potosí) is a Mexican professional footballer who currently plays for Club Tijuana in Liga MX. ==Career== On 13 April 2014, Jordan Silva made his professional debut against Club León. In May 2019 it was confirmed, that Silva had joined Club Tijuana.JORDAN SILVA SE UNIRÁ AL CLUB TIJUANA PARA EL APERTURA 2019, xolos.com.mx, 22 May 2019 ==International career== ===Mexico U-23=== On September 18, 2015 Jordan Silva was selected by coach Raul Gutierrez to play in the 2015 CONCACAF Men's Olympic Qualifying Championship. ===Senior=== Silva got his first call up to the senior Mexico side for matches against New Zealand and Panama in October 2016. ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Cruz Azul *Copa MX: Apertura 2018 ===International=== ;Mexico * Pan American Games Silver Medal: 2015 * CONCACAF Men's Olympic Qualifying Tournament: 2015 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1994 births Category:Liga MX players Category:Living people Category:Footballers from San Luis Potosí Category:Footballers at the 2015 Pan American Games Category:Footballers at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic footballers of Mexico Category:Pan American Games medalists in football Category:Pan American Games silver medalists for Mexico Category:Deportivo Toluca F.C. players Category:Cruz Azul footballers Category:Club Tijuana footballers Category:Mexico international footballers Category:Mexican footballers Category:Association football defenders
title: Jordan Silva
